item.title: Caching pipeline behavior with MediatR
item.description: The pipeline behavior is a wrapper in the MediatR and you can write some code before or after command or query handlers execute. Pipeline behaviors are a good fit for cross-cutting concerns in your application. For example in logging, caching, validation, transaction and etc. this pipeline provides an approach for us to add some additional behavior through the pipeline, without modify the original request.

item.title: Handling null: optional and nullable types
item.description: Java has long been infamous for its NullPointerException. The reason for the NPE is calling a method or accessing an attribute of an object that has not been initialized. var value=foo.getBar().getBaz().toLowerCase(); Running this snippet may result in something like the following: Exception in thread 'main' java.lang.NullPointerException at ch.frankel.blog.NpeSample.main(NpeSample.java:10) At this point, you have no clue which part is null in the call chain: foo, or the value ret

item.title: From One to Two
item.description: In his book Zero to One, Peter Thiel writes: It’s easier to copy a model than to make something new: doing what we already know how to do takes the world from 1 to n, adding more of something familiar. But every time we create something new, we go from 0 to 1. The act of creation is singular, as is the moment of creation, and the result is something fresh and strange.
item.author: (Oliver Eidel)

item.title: Semantic Versioning for Teams | Tom Gamon
item.description: I think we need a better way to track changes within a team over time. I propose borrowing the versioning system we use in software and applying it to teams to track change over time.

item.title: Big on hacker news - John's internet house
item.description: Last week I wrote a little article entitled “Maybe you should do less ‘work’”. I posted it on hacker news and it did numbers. An hour after posting it, it had one upvote. This was already a bigger success than anything else I’ve written. Then suddenly it was near the top of the homepage. And then it quickly blew through the limits of the analytics tool I use.

item.title: Exit Interviews Are a Trap - Jacob Kaplan-Moss
item.description: It’s tempting to air your grievances at your exit interview. Don’t. There’s almost no upside to speaking up, and tremendous potential downside. Avoid exit interviews if you can. If you must go, be totally bland; say nothing negative.

item.title: In response to Moxie's doubts on web3, and about ultra light clients
item.description:
Moxie just wrote his first impressions on web3. If you've been wondering about web3, and want a non-bullshit and technical glance at what it is, I think this is a really good post. While I do agree with his critics, I don't share his skepticism. Let's look at his description of how most users interact with decentralized apps (dapps):
For example, whether it’s running on mobile or the web, a dApp ...
